website_summaries.verdict: It will cost you a little more, but you'll be getting a rugged cooker that incorporates a number of high quality safety features.
pros: Available in sizes from 2.7 quarts to 10.6 quarts
Safety features include auto-locking and an automatic pressure valve
Comes with an additional glass lid top
cons: Some buyers report that this cooker came with wrong or missing parts

customer_reviews.title: I have made sweet potatoes in it
customer_reviews.text: I am a man, and I have never owned a pressure cooker.. never saw the need for one.. Until I saw a cooking show.. I use this little miracle all the time... this little gem takes a piece of elk rump and turns it into something you can chew on... I have made sweet potatoes in it... vegetables, which don't take very long I found out... I like it and will never be without a pressure cooker again...
customer_reviews.author: kikker

customer_reviews.title: air leak
customer_reviews.text: I like Fissler brand. I used a Fissler pressure cooker before, but the lid of this pressure cooker started to leak air after 3 months. I didn't drop or did anything. It is not a pressure cooker anymore, just a regular expensive pot.
customer_reviews.author: duygu

customer_reviews.title: Little pricey,  but worth it for the quality
customer_reviews.text: Love the size and works on induction cook top. Use several times weekly. Very high quality, and the stainless steel basket good quality also. Don't even use my electric pressure cookers any more. This works so much better and can control heat better on the induction cook top.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this pressure cooker!
customer_reviews.text: After having had some corned beef at a relative's home that was cooked in an electric pressure cooker, I decided to do some research before deciding to purchase this stove top unit. I have an induction stove top and decided that I wanted a stove top pressure cooker. The reviews on all of the various ones I read kept coming back to this one as being of high quality. It truly is! I've used it for a roast, vegetables, and stew. So easy to use. So easy to monitor. So easy to adjust temperature. And so easy to clean and store. I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: James B

customer_reviews.title: Faster, Tastier - a great investment!
customer_reviews.text: Incredible! I’ve been making my own stock for years - hours of cooking time. With the pressure cooker, I made the most intensely flavorful stock ever in a fraction of the time! Can’t wait to try it again! It was easy to use and to clean but it does require reading the instructions!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth H Duff

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Large Pressure Cooker
customer_reviews.text: We are from the south and love boiled peanuts. Usually you have to boil them for a number of hours. A pressure can cook wonderful boiled peanuts in about 30 minutes. Just let them soak in salt water after your pressure is released. This pot is large and will accompaniment lots of peanuts and other large items I might cook.
customer_reviews.author: REIDI C. LOTT

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, good results cooking
customer_reviews.text: I saw this pot on American Test Kitchen and am so glad I bought it. It's easy to use, easy to clean (important!!), and cooking goes so fast!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best by far
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing. Get this. You wont regret it. I cook every day in it and it makes everything so easy, potatoes cooked in 8 minutes, artichokes in 7 mins. Amazing good quality. Love, love, love.
customer_reviews.author: Daysi

customer_reviews.title: A little reminder of home
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best pressure cooker I've ever owned. After losing my last WMF pressure cooker that I brought from Germany to unfortunate life events, I have been longing for a new one. Glad I switched brands!
customer_reviews.author: germanblush

customer_reviews.title: air leak
customer_reviews.text: only after 2 month, I had a air leak from time to time. if I use long enough, I should change a gasket but this problem happens too early. disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is truly the top best pressure cooker ever
customer_reviews.text: Liked the ease of use. I use it to cook beans, rice, soup, whole chicken and more
customer_reviews.author: L. A.

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing. I've made foods that I never could. They're juicy, tender and full of flavor. I just wish they sold more/better cook books for this specific product, because the cooking times are different for every type of pressure cooker. This is the only reason it didn't get 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki

customer_reviews.title: The best, well made, pressure cooker currently available.
customer_reviews.text: This is the highest quality pressure cooker of this size currently available on the market. It reaches operating pressure very quickly and is extremely easy to clean. In this day when other manufacturers of pressure cookers have cheapened the quality of their product, it was an extremely pleasant surprise to me when I first opened the box and beheld its very sturdy construction. Since then its cooking performance has been flawless.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Roland Stucki

customer_reviews.title: The Rolls-Royce of pressure cooker
customer_reviews.text: I owned a Fagor for the past 6 years until the handle melted again. The company has gone out of business now, so I couldn't order a replacement handle like I did in the past. I decided to pay more for a Fissler this time. This is a very high quality pressure cooker. The stainless steel is thicker than the my old Fagor, and the seal is much higher quality. I think this will last me for a lot longer than 6 years. It is definitely worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: Toco Toucan

customer_reviews.title: This is good for any Family.
customer_reviews.text: I should have bought this sooner. This cooker is perfect in reducing normal cook time by 2/3rd's. I used it for stew meats, oxtails, and the like. I am glad I finally bought this. I know there are other electric counter top models available, but I wanted the stove top model as I do not trust electrical small appliances to last.
customer_reviews.author: Justforfun

customer_reviews.title: #1 ATK recommended
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, large capacity, good food, easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: hgrover

customer_reviews.title: Have used it several times with chicken and rice and other than being quick I wouldn’t say the results are superior to my standard cooking methods
customer_reviews.text: It didn’t work the first time. Did not come up to pressure and we burned about $40 worth of grassfed short ribs. Have used it several times with chicken and rice and other than being quick I wouldn’t say the results are superior to my standard cooking methods.
customer_reviews.author: Veronique

customer_reviews.title: Works on Induction Cooktops
customer_reviews.text: When we switched to an induction cooktop, we had to get rid of our old pressure cooker because it wasn't compatible. This one has the induction stamp on the bottom, and works great on induction cooktops. I love this pressure skillet. It is high quality, Made in Germany, and one of the safer designs. It has a pin that slides into a notch when the cover is locked in place, turning the safety lock indicator green. This comes in two nice gift-ready boxes; one for the cooker and another for the glass lid. Here are some photos of the inside, the stamp at the bottom, and the indicator pin.
customer_reviews.author: D. Coral

customer_reviews.title: The best of the three pressure cookers we have.
customer_reviews.text: Going to say right off the bat that I love this pressure cooker. We have an electric pressure cooker and a smaller stovetop pressurecooker, but this one beats them all. The quality and build is superior. The pressure lid fits and works perfectly. The Fissler is more "idiot proof" that the others and feels safer to use. Cooking has been more consistent than the results we were getting with our electric model. Frankly, I don't see using that one again unless we are doing a huge meal and don't have room on the stove for it. Very happy with this. Would certainly recommend. Thanks for reading.
customer_reviews.author: Work of Life

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Fissler Quality
customer_reviews.text: We have a couple of Fissler pots and pans. They are more expensive than what we usually use, but the difference is very noticeable. This is a wonderful quality cooker that will probably last forever. In fact, we use it all the time without the lid as a regular pot, not just as a pressure cooker. It's simply a joy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Silverman

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Ultimately, this is just too small for my uses. If I’m going to make a bunch of beans, or stew, I want to make enough for a couple of meals. Wish I had gotten a bigger one.
customer_reviews.author: Aya

customer_reviews.title: 5 Star Quality
customer_reviews.text: Let us be clear, this is made in Germany. This is so far ahead of most of the competition that I believe that you can truly call this a Professional Grade product. The materials and build quality are top quality. You will not be disappointed by this Fissler. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: S. Templar

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use, Easy to Clean, and Durable
customer_reviews.text: I have used pressure cookers for the past decade for a large variety of meals and I have to say that this one is a wonderful multitasking tool. It is beautifully made, with a nice hefty weighty without being too much. Pressure cooking any night of the week with this is a breeze. We made BBQ ribs last night in 35 minutes and I must say there were delicious. I highly recommend this pressure cooker, it is Easy to Use, Easy to Clean, and Durable.
customer_reviews.author: Live Laugh Love More

customer_reviews.title: These are Great Pressure Cookers
customer_reviews.text: I have two Fisslers; the 2.7 quart and the 6.4 quart. They are awesome and I cannot recommend them too highly. In addition, they have the best customer service of any company that I have come across. I recommend highly this brand
customer_reviews.author: Paul Holden

customer_reviews.title: Better than Fagor and worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Good pressure cookers are expensive. I have a Fagor model which wasn't cheap and I've always hated it. The switch that informs you it is pressurized gets gunked up and isn't reliable. This makes it very hard to cook the food for the right amount of time. And since pressure cookers finish the food so fast and you can't check on it, getting the cook time right is critical. This Fissler pot has no problems like that. It works well and is high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Ginsburg

customer_reviews.title: Quality German-made products are back!
customer_reviews.text: Solid, German-made pressure cooker and glass top makes this a perfect all-around cookware for making chili, pulled pork, pasta, etc. I have an awesome electric pressure/slow cooker, but missed the feel of a gas pressure cooker / pot (and this is better than my now-retired Presto).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Reviewer

product_meta.title: Fissler vitaquick , Pressure Cooker Set, 10.6 Quart, with Glass Lid, Stainless Steel, Cookware, Compatible with Induction, Gas, Electric Stovetops, Dishwasher Safe
product_meta.description: Size:10.6 QuartFissler vitaquick , Pressure Cooker Set, 10.6 Quart, with Glass Lid, Stainless Steel, Cookware, Compatible with Induction, Gas, Electric Stovetops, Dishwasher Safe
feature_bullets: Thanks to the cookstar all-stove base, the stainless-steel pots work on gas, electric, glass ceramic and induction
Functional: Stainless-steel pot has an internal scale for easy measurement of liquids
Locking Indicator: When the indicator turns green and you hear an audible click, the pressure cooker is securely closed and ready to cook
You'll receive a Stainless steel pressure cooker, 10.6 quart, works on all types of stovetops, with separate glass lid

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars72 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
